2020-11-03T06:49:20.483417+00:00 2020-11-13T16:00:00+00:00 20000 false pvg-global Our Company Culture is the reason behind our success!

We have minimal employee turnover due to high employee satisfaction, competitive compensation packages, and a lively and exciting working environment. PvG’s culture is one of empowerment. Employees know what is expected of them and how they are performing on a daily basis. Our workplace culture supports our mission to provide our clients with consistently reliable service using best practices that have resulted in impressive financial returns for both our clients and our company.

Work Environment and Open Door Policy

We have a family-oriented culture. Our PEOPLE is what makes PvG the kind of company that you want to work for. We hire people who share our same values and who have the same potential to be the best given the right dynamic team environment. We encourage our employees to communicate with any member of the management team about anything at anytime. We believe that every one of our employees is a hands-on contributor and what they have to say is important. Our employees can send a private message directly to the President of the company about any issue. We conduct “all hands” meetings monthly, employee surveys, and focus group discussions. If our employees have something to say – we listen.

Company Activities

We not only have company picnics, holiday celebrations, recognition ceremonies, and birthday celebrations but we also created our very own brand of league events where employees compete with other employees for team pride. Our company activities strive to maintain a healthy work life balance for our employees.

Social Responsibility

We believe there is a correlation between corporate success and social well-being. We provide assistance to a variety of organizations, including those close to our employees in the areas of child welfare and education as well as calamity support services.

Company details:

Headquarters
Newport Beach, California

Year founded
2006

Company type
Privately Held

Company size
201-500 employees

DISCOVER UNLIMITED JOB POSSIBILITIES

CONVENIENCE One Stop Shop - One Day Hiring

Get Hired in One (1) day. Don't waste hours going to different call centers and waiting a few more hours in long lines only to find out that you are not qualified or the job you are interested is not available. After you arrive in ACES CALL CENTER JOBS, you will be processed within 30 minutes and know your possible options on where you are qualified.

Since 2011, over 10,000+ jobseekers found their job through ACES!

CHOICES Comprehensive Active Jobs

Choose from the 20+ Top Call Centers, 150+ locations, 800+ positions, 10,000+ vacancies. There is a perfect job for you in ACES. In ACES, we only endorse you to clients that you have the highest chance of getting hired. Come during our ACES Days and get Hired On The Spot (HOTS)

Since 2011, ACES has consistently been awarded as the Top 3 Recruitment Partner of choice of the Biggest BPOs and Call Centers.

CHARGES It is FREE to apply and ACES gives you 3,000.00 Gift Check to qualified hires.

Since 2011, ACES has given over 30,000,000.00 (Thirty million) worth of SODEXO Gift Checks to thousands of jobseekers hired through ACES.

2020-10-22T05:57:59.211979+00:00 2020-11-29T16:00:00+00:00 false cobena-business-analytics-strategy-inc Cobena is a data analytics company founded back in 2016 by seven executives who shared a common dream: to bring data sciences into the Philippines and help create a “third leg” to the Philippine economy, after our OFWs and BPOs. The dream was simple; in a country with an abundant supply of intelligent technical graduates who were equally creative and articulate, there lay the opportunity to supply the world with data scientists: unicorns who could help make businesses smarter with data-driven decision making.

Fast forward, three years later, Cobena is now at the forefront of the data sciences industry in the Philippines, and in 2018 was recognized by APAC CIO magazine to be among the Top 10 Business Intelligence Providers in the Asia Pacific. And, beginning this year, APAC Business Insights recognized Cobena to be among Asia Pacific’s Fastest Growing Data analytics companies. Both publications are based in Silicon Valley.

In its brief history, Cobena has had over 100 projects across the Philippines, South East Asia, Hong Kong, and Japan. Among its top clients are Multinationals like Nestle, Unilever, and Johnson & Johnson, and some of the country’s top conglomerates like Ayala, San Miguel, Globe, JG Summit, and Metrobank. Cobena has offices in the Philippines and Singapore.

Beyond its roster of top clients, Cobena is extremely proud of its 40 Data Scientists and Business analysts, who hold top honors and master’s degrees from the country’s premier universities. Where other companies still struggle to find the magic formula when it comes to succeeding with millennials, Cobena seems to have found just what it takes to breed and keep the country’s top talent. Cobena in August 2020, became part of Demand Sciences, a business intelligence platform based in Boston Massachusetts.

<p><strong>What Is Your Role </strong></p>

<p>One of our Clients is found an opportunity to consolidate services by migrating over to Microsoft’s services: Outlook, OneDrive, Sharepoint, and Microsoft Teams. <p>As a Project Analyst you will be responsible for helping our Client get fully accustomed to Office 365 by auditing the Client’s old tools and software, documenting their processes, and optimizing their workflows.</p>

<p>The role will require keen attention to detail while maintaining quality. You will be working with different tools and databases to gather, organize, and interpret new information.</p>

<ul>
<li>Setup Framework on MS Suite; identify use cases for each tool</li>
<li>Migrate data into the agreed-upon framework</li>
<li>Grant access and invite team members to specific folders</li>
<li>Train team members on the uses cases and framework for each tool</li>
</ul>

- Food ingredients and raw materials

- Industrial chemicals

Our Headquarters are located in Parañaque City, Metro Manila, Philippines. The Representative Office is situated in Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon), Vietnam.

History

Our years of first-hand frontline experience in the marketplace, know-how in sourcing from manufacturers and traders world-wide, and European Management with Oriental Expertise provide both, suppliers and clients, with a reliable partner for a long-term business relationship and mutual benefit.

WHY JOIN US?

Rudolf Lietz Inc. recognizes how strong work performance makes the company successful.

One way to accomplish this is to offer a comprehensive benefit program designed to meet your basic and life-changing benefit needs. From full medical coverage to generous paid holidays and vacations. RLI's package is consistently and continually being assessed to ensure competitiveness.

Cultures and Values

Rudolf Lietz Inc. is a German-Filipino company located at Paranaque City, Philippines. Our culture follows that of similar German companies where we take pride on being organised, working to the book and executing high quality work. It is of utmost importance to stay not just one but several steps ahead of the competition but doing so through the quality of work. We also invite our team members to be creative with the work they do often working in smaller teams to solve much bigger problem.

DISCOVER UNLIMITED JOB POSSIBILITIES

CONVENIENCE One Stop Shop - One Day Hiring

Get Hired in One (1) day. Don't waste hours going to different call centers and waiting a few more hours in long lines only to find out that you are not qualified or the job you are interested is not available. After you arrive in ACES CALL CENTER JOBS, you will be processed within 30 minutes and know your possible options on where you are qualified.

Since 2011, over 10,000+ jobseekers found their job through ACES!

CHOICES Comprehensive Active Jobs

Choose from the 20+ Top Call Centers, 150+ locations, 800+ positions, 10,000+ vacancies. There is a perfect job for you in ACES. In ACES, we only endorse you to clients that you have the highest chance of getting hired. Come during our ACES Days and get Hired On The Spot (HOTS)

Since 2011, ACES has consistently been awarded as the Top 3 Recruitment Partner of choice of the Biggest BPOs and Call Centers.

CHARGES It is FREE to apply and ACES gives you 3,000.00 Gift Check to qualified hires.

It is FREE to apply with us. ACES Call Center Jobs is the only company in the Philippines that gives an extra Php 3,000.00 SODEXO Gift Checks to its successful hires. This is on top of the incentives that you get from the call centers and is given by ACES.

Since 2011, ACES has given over 30,000,000.00 (Thirty million) worth of SODEXO Gift Checks to thousands of jobseekers hired through ACES.

We have minimal employee turnover due to high employee satisfaction, competitive compensation packages, and a lively and exciting working environment. PvG’s culture is one of empowerment. Employees know what is expected of them and how they are performing on a daily basis. Our workplace culture supports our mission to provide our clients with consistently reliable service using best practices that have resulted in impressive financial returns for both our clients and our company.

Work Environment and Open Door Policy

We have a family-oriented culture. Our PEOPLE is what makes PvG the kind of company that you want to work for. We hire people who share our same values and who have the same potential to be the best given the right dynamic team environment. We encourage our employees to communicate with any member of the management team about anything at anytime. We believe that every one of our employees is a hands-on contributor and what they have to say is important. Our employees can send a private message directly to the President of the company about any issue. We conduct “all hands” meetings monthly, employee surveys, and focus group discussions. If our employees have something to say – we listen.

Company Activities

We not only have company picnics, holiday celebrations, recognition ceremonies, and birthday celebrations but we also created our very own brand of league events where employees compete with other employees for team pride. Our company activities strive to maintain a healthy work life balance for our employees.

Social Responsibility

We believe there is a correlation between corporate success and social well-being. We provide assistance to a variety of organizations, including those close to our employees in the areas of child welfare and education as well as calamity support services.

DISCOVER UNLIMITED JOB POSSIBILITIES

CONVENIENCE One Stop Shop - One Day Hiring

Get Hired in One (1) day. Don't waste hours going to different call centers and waiting a few more hours in long lines only to find out that you are not qualified or the job you are interested is not available. After you arrive in ACES CALL CENTER JOBS, you will be processed within 30 minutes and know your possible options on where you are qualified.

Since 2011, over 10,000+ jobseekers found their job through ACES!

CHOICES Comprehensive Active Jobs

Choose from the 20+ Top Call Centers, 150+ locations, 800+ positions, 10,000+ vacancies. There is a perfect job for you in ACES. In ACES, we only endorse you to clients that you have the highest chance of getting hired. Come during our ACES Days and get Hired On The Spot (HOTS)

Since 2011, ACES has consistently been awarded as the Top 3 Recruitment Partner of choice of the Biggest BPOs and Call Centers.

CHARGES It is FREE to apply and ACES gives you 3,000.00 Gift Check to qualified hires.

It is FREE to apply with us. ACES Call Center Jobs is the only company in the Philippines that gives an extra Php 3,000.00 SODEXO Gift Checks to its successful hires. This is on top of the incentives that you get from the call centers and is given by ACES.

Since 2011, ACES has given over 30,000,000.00 (Thirty million) worth of SODEXO Gift Checks to thousands of jobseekers hired through ACES.

In 1986, the company under the leadership of the Conchanco siblings, evolved as an active trading enterprise dealing in fast moving consumer goods.

Fly Ace Corporation was incorporated in 1993. The company first ventured into its first owned brand with canned vegetables and packaged fruits under the JOLLY brand in 1997. This was followed by several other company owned brands to include Mediterranean products under the Dona Elena brand, oriental food products under the Good Life brand and Milk products under the Jolly Cow brand.

From a small office in Binondo, Manila, the company is now housed in its own headquarters, the Fly Ace Corporate Center, in Central Business Park, Pasay City. From having two employees, Fly Ace now employs more than two hundred professionals, all experts in their respective fields.		 24975 Food / Beverages https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/logos/UNHKAQ6DS8XWTLYW7V4EZDVM6975DY9SLX9A3YXC-5af27ac0.png Fly Ace Corporation false true fly-ace-corporation-2 In 1972, Lucio Conchanco Sr. and Ederlina Cochanco, began a family legacy by setting up The Jolly General Merchandise as a retailer of agricultural products. <p>The Account Receivable Analyst is primarily responsible for effectively managing account receivables of the company and ensures that these are well-monitored and updated regularly. He/she needs to ensure that all credit policies are complied with.</p>

<p>Key Job Results include accurate, reliable, detailed and timely updating of account balances as well as professional growth of staff. As needed, provides customer assistance related to accounts reconciliation.</p>

<p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong></p>

<p><strong>Planning</strong></p>

<p>1. Works with the Immediate Superior in preparing new A/R policies and procedures.</p>

<p><strong>Doing/Execution </strong></p>

<p>2. Provides weekly Total AR report of handled accounts</p>

<p>3. Updates Account Balances in the SAP System.</p>

<p>3.1. Record/Clear payments to specific invoices.</p>

<p>3.2. Record/Clear validated returns and customer deductions.</p>

<p>4. Creates and Summarizes Unauthorized Customer Deductions and Returns Report.</p>

<p>5. Presents and explains new or revised A/R policies to concerned personnel.</p>

<p><strong>Checking/Monitoring</strong></p>

<p>6. Monitors Overdue Accounts</p>

<p>6.1 Provides updates to Sales Representative and/or client with their outstanding balances.</p>

<p>6.2 Works with Sales Representative in clearing or following up client’s overdue account.</p>

<p>6.2.1 Prepares letter for short payments and overdue accounts.</p>

<p>6.3 Prepares statement of accounts as requested by the customer or sales representative.</p>

<p>7. Checks and Validates Customer Returns and Deductions.</p>

<p>7.1 Coordination with concerned departments in validating customer deductions.</p>

<p>7.1.1 Checks returns deducted from the payment and validate its accuracy with the Warehouse Team.</p>

<p>7.2 Investigates client’s service level penalty.</p>

<p>8. Checks accuracy of Expanded Withholding Tax (EWT) computation.</p>

<p>8.1 Ensures that EWT computations are correct and must have a corresponding EWT certificate submitted by the customer.</p>

<p><strong>Acting/Adjusting </strong></p>

<p>9. Provides reliable, timely management reports on accounts receivables.</p>

<p>10. Works with A/R Supervisor and AVP-SSG in reviewing and revising existing A/R policies and procedures.</p>

<p>11. Recommends solutions in addressing unauthorized returns and deductions by the customer.</p>

<p>12. Prepares letter for add-back on unauthorized deductions.</p>

<p><strong>Others</strong></p>

<p>1. Performs other tasks as assigned by the Immediate Superiors.</p>		 550 false 2020-11-09T09:21:17.392507+00:00 Accounting and Finance 7th Floor Fly Ace Corporate Center, 13 Coral Way, Pasay, Metro Manila, Philippines (Beside KLine Bldg. near Jetti gas station in Macapagal Blvd. and also near MOA Arena) Davao City Philippines Davao Region 163357 false false 2020-10-28T08:48:30.921153+00:00 163357 2015-05-21T02:23:19.965292+00:00 false 1222 SAP Business One 2016-06-30T02:20:01.343690+00:00 1222 2020-10-28T08:48:30.921153+00:00 163357 2015-06-06T12:06:27.767124+00:00 false 2186 Billing and Invoicing 2016-06-30T02:20:01.343690+00:00 2186 2020-10-28T08:48:30.921153+00:00 163357 2015-06-16T06:39:52.083383+00:00 false 2526 Accounts Receivable 2016-06-30T02:20:01.343690+00:00 2526 2020-10-28T08:48:30.921153+00:00 163357 2015-08-27T06:27:46.272453+00:00 false 5124 Bank Reconciliation 2016-09-22T17:31:48.398823+00:00 5124 20000 Accounts Receivable Analyst 1 retirement med_ins sick_leave family_leave life_ins paid_leave mat_pat_leave 1 <p><strong>Competency Requirements:</strong></p>

2020-10-28T07:26:27.296327+00:00 2020-12-28T16:00:00+00:00 23000 false filstar-distributors-corporation Filstar Distributors Corporation maintains the prestige of being the exclusive licensee of Hallmark Cards in the Philippines since 1974. In addition, it was made the authorized distributor of the following brands:

• Pioneer Balloons from the U.S.A. in 1995
• BIC Stationery products from France in 2001; BIC Lighters and Shavers (exclusive distributorship)
• Everts Balloons from Malaysia in 2003
• Martha Stewart Crafts
• Scentco
• Disney Art Attack in 2012 (Licensee)
• Crayola (Licensee)

The company was the first to introduce the scrapbooking hobby in the Philippines, creating the brand Craft Easy, formerly known as All About Scrapbooking.

Other of its locally-created brands include:

• Celebration Balloons
• Wrapsody - a line of high-end quality gift wrap paper with special effects
• Wrap 'Em Up – ribbons and quick gift wrapping ideas
• Photofun photo albums

THE STORY OF THE HALLMARK BRAND AND FILSTAR, THE COMPANY, IN THE PHILIPPINES

The beginnings of Hallmark in the Philippines had its share of twists and charm. In 1969, people from Kansas City, U.S.A., home of the Hallmark headquarters, came to the Philippines looking for a local licensee. It was in National Book Store (NBS) that Hallmark discovered the qualities they too valued: the premium placed on excellence and the right attitude towards growth. These were the same qualities which the founder of NBS, Mrs. Socorro C. Ramos, valued.

It was a Good Friday when Mrs. Ramos was approached by Hallmark U.S.A. Thereafter, she went to Kansas City to arrange the deal and successfully came back with the license to manufacture and distribute Hallmark in the Philippines. It was on her kitchen table that the very first cards were planned. This was in 1973, the start of the Hallmark- NBS partnership. The next year, Hallmark cards made their appearance on the racks of National Book Store.

What followed were years of astounding growth and excellence. In product lines, from Christmas to everyday themes, more greeting cards and other excellent products have been added on each year to establish a full line of quality Hallmark merchandise.

Today, Filstar distributes to 1,000 outlets nationwide and has evolved to be a distributor of not just Hallmark, but of other products that supplement and enhance the personal expressions industry. The successful introduction of the All About Scrapbooking brand spearheaded the art of scrapbooking in the Philippines. It is now the top of mind brand of scrapbooking enthusiasts and hobbyists.		 22812 Retail Industry https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/logos/HE3KW56HQ9WRQHMYHZ4Y-5a2118fe.png Filstar Distributors Corporation true true filstar-distributors-corporation Filstar Distributors Corporation maintains the prestige of being the exclusive licensee of Hallmark Cards in the Philippines since 1974. In addition, it was made the authorized distributor of the following brands:

• Pioneer Balloons from the U.S.A. in 1995
• BIC Stationery products from France in 2001; BIC Lighters and Shavers (exclusive distributorship)
• Everts Balloons from Malaysia in 2003
• Martha Stewart Crafts
• Scentco
• Disney Art Attack in 2012 (Licensee)
• Crayola (Licensee)

The company was the first to introduce the scrapbooking hobby in the Philippines, creating the brand Craft Easy, formerly known as All About Scrapbooking.

Other of its locally-created brands include:

• Celebration Balloons
• Wrapsody - a line of high-end quality gift wrap paper with special effects
• Wrap 'Em Up – ribbons and quick gift wrapping ideas
• Photofun photo albums

Thereafter, she went to Kansas City to arrange the deal and successfully came back with the license to manufacture and distribute Hallmark in the Philippines. 2020-10-08T03:39:40.872813+00:00 2020-12-29T16:00:00+00:00 false sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

SKY Cable Corporation is the pay television and broadband arm of ABS-CBN, the Philippines’ leading media and entertainment company.

Since introducing cable television to Filipinos in 1990, it has become a frontrunner in pay TV and broadband services that offer rich content that entertain, educate, inspire, and offer experiences to Filipinos, whom it considers as its Kapamilyas.

Today, it serves Filipinos through various products under SKYdirect, SKY Fiber, and SKYcable.

SKYcable is a Pay TV service offering HD cable TV with top-notch programming and the widest selection of channels on offer by any cable provider; and SKY Fiber, a high-speed broadband for the home and beyond.

SKYdirect, now in over one million homes nationwide, brings SKY’s superior brand of cable entertainment options to more areas, beyond the urban centers via direct-to-home television technology.

SKY serves the business community through SKYBIZ, Its corporate and commercial arm, which delivers content (SKYcable) and connectivity (SKY Fiber) services to any business of any size.		 17061 Cable and Telecommunications https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/www.kalibrr.com/logos/YRBMYTQF3DTVF5CA8X8H3R9YA46P7R77P2BYHV97-5e4e207b.png Sky Cable Corporation false true sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

CWSI was incorporated on May 18, 2012. Since August 2, 2012, Filinvest Land, Inc. 2020-09-04T10:03:49.738931+00:00 2020-12-03T16:00:00+00:00 22000 false coredata-research-services-inc Founded in Sydney in 2002 as a specialist in financial services research, CoreData has since grown its operations and ventured into other industries to provide clients with information, insights and frameworks to help grow businesses.

CoreData Group includes three separate businesses: CoreData Consulting, CoreData Research and CoreData Panel. The Group’s consulting business leverages research capabilities and market insight to provide strategic solutions for clients with complex problems. The research business offers both qualitative and quantitative research reports and analysis for clients with pure research needs, while the panel business sells access to respondents from our consumer database of more than 130,000 Australians.

At the centre of CoreData is a highly disciplined and efficient research business which delivers customer, sales and service channel insights to help businesses better understand the market in which they are operating and their relative strengths and weaknesses.
Clients benefit from a dual offering of business-to-business and business-to-consumer research and consulting services.

The CoreData team has the skills and experience to identify patterns that are emerging and translate this into opportunities for our clients.

The CoreData team has a depth of industry experience that reflects a rich understanding of the changing environment. We are experienced at gathering, disseminating and presenting information through face-to-face meetings and written reports. Our expertise include investigating market trends and potential, helping clients build long-term customer relationships, product testing and advertising, measuring public opinion and consumer behaviour.

What We Believe In

At CoreData we have a passion for data and insights.

We believe in bridging the gap between high quality market intelligence and insight.

We use experience and knowledge to develop marketing strategies that work and then partner with our clients to implement these strategies.

In today’s fast moving world, the ability to adapt quickly and intelligently is a key driver of success.

At CoreData we are focused on helping our clients to understand how changes in the broader market affect the businesses in which they operate.

We believe in the following Core Values:

C-Curiosity
O-Organized
R-Responsive
E-Excellence
D-Driven
A-Accountable
T-Team work
A-Adapatable

We adhere to highest ethical and legal practices in research. We never compromise the integrity of our data.

CoreData Group includes three separate businesses: CoreData Consulting, CoreData Research and CoreData Panel. The Group’s consulting business leverages research capabilities and market insight to provide strategic solutions for clients with complex problems. The research business offers both qualitative and quantitative research reports and analysis for clients with pure research needs, while the panel business sells access to respondents from our consumer database of more than 130,000 Australians.

At the centre of CoreData is a highly disciplined and efficient research business which delivers customer, sales and service channel insights to help businesses better understand the market in which they are operating and their relative strengths and weaknesses.
Clients benefit from a dual offering of business-to-business and business-to-consumer research and consulting services.

The CoreData team has the skills and experience to identify patterns that are emerging and translate this into opportunities for our clients.

The CoreData team has a depth of industry experience that reflects a rich understanding of the changing environment. We are experienced at gathering, disseminating and presenting information through face-to-face meetings and written reports. Our expertise include investigating market trends and potential, helping clients build long-term customer relationships, product testing and advertising, measuring public opinion and consumer behaviour.

What We Believe In

At CoreData we have a passion for data and insights.

We believe in bridging the gap between high quality market intelligence and insight.

We use experience and knowledge to develop marketing strategies that work and then partner with our clients to implement these strategies.

In today’s fast moving world, the ability to adapt quickly and intelligently is a key driver of success.

At CoreData we are focused on helping our clients to understand how changes in the broader market affect the businesses in which they operate.

2020-11-09T03:25:24.905932+00:00 2020-11-14T16:00:00+00:00 false ramesh-trading-corporation-1 RAMESH TRADING was founded in 1948 as a General Merchandise Store and as the years went by became an importer, distributor, and wholesaler of general merchandise.

In 2006, Ramesh Trading changed its business type to Corporation as part of its efforts to improve itself in the new millennium coupled with the entry of the 3rd Generation now handling the business. After over 70 years of its existence, the company has successfully branched out its endeavors into importing, wholesaling and distributorship. In 2014, the Corporation moved to a bigger facility located in Pasay City which is in line with its expansion efforts. This will further improve the company's overall efficiency and effectiveness ratings and speed up its operations.

With the company's vision of supplying every room in every household in the Philippines, we continue to deliver quality goods and services to our customers. We have branched out with our professional line of products and have also been supplying Hotels, Restaurants, Caterers, Cafes and Culinary Schools with our Industrial Grade products.

Today in terms of product availability, quality, durability, and affordability, we at Ramesh Trading Corporation are enjoying a reputation for being one of the most reliable suppliers in the country.		 16543 Importer | Wholesaler | Distributor https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/www.kalibrr.com/logos/RRFM9A955SAR5CZBMZZJLLFGLHF9WJ3RDQL36TSK-5e1d805f.png Ramesh Trading Corporation true true ramesh-trading-corporation-1 RAMESH TRADING was founded in 1948 as a General Merchandise Store and as the years went by became an importer, distributor, and wholesaler of general merchandise.

2020-10-08T05:49:22.699406+00:00 2020-11-29T16:00:00+00:00 18000 false filstar-distributors-corporation Filstar Distributors Corporation maintains the prestige of being the exclusive licensee of Hallmark Cards in the Philippines since 1974. In addition, it was made the authorized distributor of the following brands:

• Pioneer Balloons from the U.S.A. in 1995
• BIC Stationery products from France in 2001; BIC Lighters and Shavers (exclusive distributorship)
• Everts Balloons from Malaysia in 2003
• Martha Stewart Crafts
• Scentco
• Disney Art Attack in 2012 (Licensee)
• Crayola (Licensee)

The company was the first to introduce the scrapbooking hobby in the Philippines, creating the brand Craft Easy, formerly known as All About Scrapbooking.

Other of its locally-created brands include:

• Celebration Balloons
• Wrapsody - a line of high-end quality gift wrap paper with special effects
• Wrap 'Em Up – ribbons and quick gift wrapping ideas
• Photofun photo albums

THE STORY OF THE HALLMARK BRAND AND FILSTAR, THE COMPANY, IN THE PHILIPPINES

The beginnings of Hallmark in the Philippines had its share of twists and charm. In 1969, people from Kansas City, U.S.A., home of the Hallmark headquarters, came to the Philippines looking for a local licensee. It was in National Book Store (NBS) that Hallmark discovered the qualities they too valued: the premium placed on excellence and the right attitude towards growth. These were the same qualities which the founder of NBS, Mrs. Socorro C. Ramos, valued.

It was a Good Friday when Mrs. Ramos was approached by Hallmark U.S.A. Thereafter, she went to Kansas City to arrange the deal and successfully came back with the license to manufacture and distribute Hallmark in the Philippines. It was on her kitchen table that the very first cards were planned. This was in 1973, the start of the Hallmark- NBS partnership. The next year, Hallmark cards made their appearance on the racks of National Book Store.

What followed were years of astounding growth and excellence. In product lines, from Christmas to everyday themes, more greeting cards and other excellent products have been added on each year to establish a full line of quality Hallmark merchandise.

Today, Filstar distributes to 1,000 outlets nationwide and has evolved to be a distributor of not just Hallmark, but of other products that supplement and enhance the personal expressions industry. The successful introduction of the All About Scrapbooking brand spearheaded the art of scrapbooking in the Philippines. It is now the top of mind brand of scrapbooking enthusiasts and hobbyists.		 22812 Retail Industry https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/logos/HE3KW56HQ9WRQHMYHZ4Y-5a2118fe.png Filstar Distributors Corporation true true filstar-distributors-corporation Filstar Distributors Corporation maintains the prestige of being the exclusive licensee of Hallmark Cards in the Philippines since 1974. In addition, it was made the authorized distributor of the following brands:

• Pioneer Balloons from the U.S.A. in 1995
• BIC Stationery products from France in 2001; BIC Lighters and Shavers (exclusive distributorship)
• Everts Balloons from Malaysia in 2003
• Martha Stewart Crafts
• Scentco
• Disney Art Attack in 2012 (Licensee)
• Crayola (Licensee)

The company was the first to introduce the scrapbooking hobby in the Philippines, creating the brand Craft Easy, formerly known as All About Scrapbooking.

Other of its locally-created brands include:

• Celebration Balloons
• Wrapsody - a line of high-end quality gift wrap paper with special effects
• Wrap 'Em Up – ribbons and quick gift wrapping ideas
• Photofun photo albums

THE STORY OF THE HALLMARK BRAND AND FILSTAR, THE COMPANY, IN THE PHILIPPINES

The beginnings of Hallmark in the Philippines had its share of twists and charm. In 1969, people from Kansas City, U.S.A., home of the Hallmark headquarters, came to the Philippines looking for a local licensee. It was in National Book Store (NBS) that Hallmark discovered the qualities they too valued: the premium placed on excellence and the right attitude towards growth. These were the same qualities which the founder of NBS, Mrs. Socorro C. Ramos, valued.

It was a Good Friday when Mrs. Ramos was approached by Hallmark U.S.A. Thereafter, she went to Kansas City to arrange the deal and successfully came back with the license to manufacture and distribute Hallmark in the Philippines. It was on her kitchen table that the very first cards were planned. This was in 1973, the start of the Hallmark- NBS partnership. The next year, Hallmark cards made their appearance on the racks of National Book Store.

What followed were years of astounding growth and excellence. In product lines, from Christmas to everyday themes, more greeting cards and other excellent products have been added on each year to establish a full line of quality Hallmark merchandise.

Today, Filstar distributes to 1,000 outlets nationwide and has evolved to be a distributor of not just Hallmark, but of other products that supplement and enhance the personal expressions industry. <li>Performs the following duties which include but not limited to:</li>
<li>Grew profitability and built a book of business from the ground up through research, cold calling, new business development, negotiations, account expansion, and customer visits</li>
<li>Prospect, cold call, schedule meetings, perform client needs assessments, sell products and services using consultative sales techniques, overcome objections, negotiate contracts, close sales, and perform general account management.</li>
<li>Makes sales presentations to prospective clients</li>
<li>Liaison between the customer and truck operator, taking ownership in the customer's product and needs</li>
<li>Ensures that all client freight loads are shipped on time</li>

<p>As a part of Global CSM Business Operations team, this role will work in partnership with senior executives across the regional CSLT teams and will provide operational support for the delivery of KPIs and critical initiatives.</p>

<p><strong>Responsibilities: </strong></p>

<ol>
<li><strong>Lead business performance measurement efforts</strong></li>
</ol>

<ul>
<li>Support the Director– Business Operations in specified region in timely publication of regional and market-level key performance indicators (KPIs)</li>
<li>Drive scalability of all reporting efforts through process development, template standardization, and automated data extraction</li>
<li>Help drive commissions execution off the back of KPI collation</li>
</ul>

<p><strong> 2. Help handle tools to provide data driven analysis</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Maintain key business process tools including Salesforce from a CSM perspective.</li>
<li>Help drive data analysis utilizing Tableau dashboards and support frontline teams with usage and troubleshooting.</li>
</ul>

<p> 3. <strong>Support Director– Business Operations in day-to-day and adhoc requests</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Collaborate closely across various teams in the region to collect appropriate data and insight for adhoc requests throughout the year</li>

2020-10-20T07:18:40.249447+00:00 2021-02-27T16:00:00+00:00 false sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

SKY Cable Corporation is the pay television and broadband arm of ABS-CBN, the Philippines’ leading media and entertainment company.

Since introducing cable television to Filipinos in 1990, it has become a frontrunner in pay TV and broadband services that offer rich content that entertain, educate, inspire, and offer experiences to Filipinos, whom it considers as its Kapamilyas.

Today, it serves Filipinos through various products under SKYdirect, SKY Fiber, and SKYcable.

SKYcable is a Pay TV service offering HD cable TV with top-notch programming and the widest selection of channels on offer by any cable provider; and SKY Fiber, a high-speed broadband for the home and beyond.

SKYdirect, now in over one million homes nationwide, brings SKY’s superior brand of cable entertainment options to more areas, beyond the urban centers via direct-to-home television technology.

SKY serves the business community through SKYBIZ, Its corporate and commercial arm, which delivers content (SKYcable) and connectivity (SKY Fiber) services to any business of any size.		 17061 Cable and Telecommunications https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/www.kalibrr.com/logos/YRBMYTQF3DTVF5CA8X8H3R9YA46P7R77P2BYHV97-5e4e207b.png Sky Cable Corporation false true sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

2020-11-09T03:36:49.100343+00:00 2021-03-30T16:00:00+00:00 false sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

SKY Cable Corporation is the pay television and broadband arm of ABS-CBN, the Philippines’ leading media and entertainment company.

Since introducing cable television to Filipinos in 1990, it has become a frontrunner in pay TV and broadband services that offer rich content that entertain, educate, inspire, and offer experiences to Filipinos, whom it considers as its Kapamilyas.

Today, it serves Filipinos through various products under SKYdirect, SKY Fiber, and SKYcable.

SKYcable is a Pay TV service offering HD cable TV with top-notch programming and the widest selection of channels on offer by any cable provider; and SKY Fiber, a high-speed broadband for the home and beyond.

SKYdirect, now in over one million homes nationwide, brings SKY’s superior brand of cable entertainment options to more areas, beyond the urban centers via direct-to-home television technology.

SKY serves the business community through SKYBIZ, Its corporate and commercial arm, which delivers content (SKYcable) and connectivity (SKY Fiber) services to any business of any size.		 17061 Cable and Telecommunications https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/www.kalibrr.com/logos/YRBMYTQF3DTVF5CA8X8H3R9YA46P7R77P2BYHV97-5e4e207b.png Sky Cable Corporation false true sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

He/she needs to work closely with key stakeholders to define the testing activities and scope needed on the project/release.</p>

<p>A Test Analyst may oversee a team and serve as subject matter expert for the said team. He/she most of the time assumes the Test Lead role in a project / release.</p>

<p><strong><em>Responsibilities:</em></strong></p>

<p><strong>Testing Activities (Test Design and Execution)</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Reviews and provide feedback to requirements reviews/discussions</li>
<li>Develops a test plan that leads to effective testing with optimal test coverage, based on the deep understanding of the business domain and/or project/release/component.</li>
<li>Design efficient and effective test scenarios and cases, based on the in-depth understanding of the business domain and application functionalities and features.</li>
<li>Considers testability when reviewing the designs which result in more testable features and better test coverage.</li>
<li>Applies knowledge of software development process for early discovery of defects and higher quality builds</li>
<li>Performs actual test execution and analyze test results of highly complex programs/projects/releases.</li>
<li>Facilitates the discovery of potential issues through the application of appropriate testing methodologies.</li>
<li>Analyzes patterns of defects to identify test holes for a feature area.</li>
<li>Develops and documents quality risks and mitigations.</li>
<li>Develops new documentation and project testing/quality procedures.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Test Coordination and Guidance</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Be an advocate for quality.</li>
<li>Provides leadership, guidance and direction to less experienced testers / users in resolution of escalated issues and/or complex production, application or system problems.</li>
<li>Drives the project test team to test effectively and efficiently to meet quality standards and deadlines.</li>
<li>Helps resolve issues/remove roadblocks for the project test team and/or escalate accordingly.</li>
<li>Provides regular quality status updates to IT testing lead and/or project stakeholders</li>
<li>Ensures efficient and effective delivery of service; Recommends and implement process improvements</li>
</ul>		 550 false 2020-11-09T09:02:48.004605+00:00 IT and Software ABS-CBN Compound Mother Ignacia Avenue Quezon City Philippines Metro Manila 152117 false false Test Automation Analyst | Manager Level 3 1 <ul>

<li>Perform ongoing keyword research including discovery and expansion of keyword opportunities</li>
<li>Test and implement various search engine marketing techniques, website layouts, and advertising for search engine optimization.</li>
<li>Optimize copy and landing pages for research engine marketing.</li>
<li>Research and implement search engine optimization recommendations</li>
<li>Research and analyze competitor advertising links</li>
<li>Develop and implement link building strategy</li>
<li>(Combination of work in the office and work from home)</li>

2020-10-27T09:10:25.884486+00:00 2020-12-25T16:00:00+00:00 20000 false boutique-outsource-solutions-pty-ltd-philippine-branch History

Boutique Outsource Solutions Pty Ltd. – Philippine Branch (BOS) was established in 2014 in response to a need to provide a more personalized approach to the provision of outsource staff. It was set up by its parent company in Australia to specialize in servicing Australian-based finance-related companies who want to set up off-shore operations in the Philippines.

The extensive experience of BOS executive management team and support professionals in the fields of mortgage, process management and business process outsourcing is our edge against the other players in the industry as we are able to deliver a truly exceptional level of service that is made more unique because of our ability to tailor our solutions to our clients’ needs.

And because we offer flexible solutions, our business model is equally effective across a variety of businesses. We give our clients the liberty and the ability to focus on improving their business processes while BOS works to ensure we provide them with all the rest of their operational requirements.

Our Vision

Our vision is to attain sustainable and profitable growth by providing the best quality boutique solutions and services to our clients achieved through our people’s diverse talents and skills in an environment that fosters passion, excellence, honesty and lasting relationships while keeping in mind that work should always be fun and empowering.

Boutique Outsource Solutions Pty Ltd. – Philippine Branch (BOS) was established in 2014 in response to a need to provide a more personalized approach to the provision of outsource staff. It was set up by its parent company in Australia to specialize in servicing Australian-based finance-related companies who want to set up off-shore operations in the Philippines.

The extensive experience of BOS executive management team and support professionals in the fields of mortgage, process management and business process outsourcing is our edge against the other players in the industry as we are able to deliver a truly exceptional level of service that is made more unique because of our ability to tailor our solutions to our clients’ needs.

And because we offer flexible solutions, our business model is equally effective across a variety of businesses. We give our clients the liberty and the ability to focus on improving their business processes while BOS works to ensure we provide them with all the rest of their operational requirements.

Our Vision

Our vision is to attain sustainable and profitable growth by providing the best quality boutique solutions and services to our clients achieved through our people’s diverse talents and skills in an environment that fosters passion, excellence, honesty and lasting relationships while keeping in mind that work should always be fun and empowering.

2020-10-08T05:49:24.212888+00:00 2020-11-29T16:00:00+00:00 18000 false filstar-distributors-corporation Filstar Distributors Corporation maintains the prestige of being the exclusive licensee of Hallmark Cards in the Philippines since 1974. In addition, it was made the authorized distributor of the following brands:

• Pioneer Balloons from the U.S.A. in 1995
• BIC Stationery products from France in 2001; BIC Lighters and Shavers (exclusive distributorship)
• Everts Balloons from Malaysia in 2003
• Martha Stewart Crafts
• Scentco
• Disney Art Attack in 2012 (Licensee)
• Crayola (Licensee)

The company was the first to introduce the scrapbooking hobby in the Philippines, creating the brand Craft Easy, formerly known as All About Scrapbooking.

Other of its locally-created brands include:

• Celebration Balloons
• Wrapsody - a line of high-end quality gift wrap paper with special effects
• Wrap 'Em Up – ribbons and quick gift wrapping ideas
• Photofun photo albums

THE STORY OF THE HALLMARK BRAND AND FILSTAR, THE COMPANY, IN THE PHILIPPINES

The beginnings of Hallmark in the Philippines had its share of twists and charm. In 1969, people from Kansas City, U.S.A., home of the Hallmark headquarters, came to the Philippines looking for a local licensee. It was in National Book Store (NBS) that Hallmark discovered the qualities they too valued: the premium placed on excellence and the right attitude towards growth. These were the same qualities which the founder of NBS, Mrs. Socorro C. Ramos, valued.

It was a Good Friday when Mrs. Ramos was approached by Hallmark U.S.A. Thereafter, she went to Kansas City to arrange the deal and successfully came back with the license to manufacture and distribute Hallmark in the Philippines. It was on her kitchen table that the very first cards were planned. This was in 1973, the start of the Hallmark- NBS partnership. The next year, Hallmark cards made their appearance on the racks of National Book Store.

What followed were years of astounding growth and excellence. In product lines, from Christmas to everyday themes, more greeting cards and other excellent products have been added on each year to establish a full line of quality Hallmark merchandise.

Today, Filstar distributes to 1,000 outlets nationwide and has evolved to be a distributor of not just Hallmark, but of other products that supplement and enhance the personal expressions industry. The successful introduction of the All About Scrapbooking brand spearheaded the art of scrapbooking in the Philippines. It is now the top of mind brand of scrapbooking enthusiasts and hobbyists.		 22812 Retail Industry https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/logos/HE3KW56HQ9WRQHMYHZ4Y-5a2118fe.png Filstar Distributors Corporation true true filstar-distributors-corporation Filstar Distributors Corporation maintains the prestige of being the exclusive licensee of Hallmark Cards in the Philippines since 1974. In addition, it was made the authorized distributor of the following brands:

• Pioneer Balloons from the U.S.A. in 1995
• BIC Stationery products from France in 2001; BIC Lighters and Shavers (exclusive distributorship)
• Everts Balloons from Malaysia in 2003
• Martha Stewart Crafts
• Scentco
• Disney Art Attack in 2012 (Licensee)
• Crayola (Licensee)

The company was the first to introduce the scrapbooking hobby in the Philippines, creating the brand Craft Easy, formerly known as All About Scrapbooking.

Other of its locally-created brands include:

• Celebration Balloons
• Wrapsody - a line of high-end quality gift wrap paper with special effects
• Wrap 'Em Up – ribbons and quick gift wrapping ideas
• Photofun photo albums

It was a Good Friday when Mrs. Ramos was approached by Hallmark U.S.A. Thereafter, she went to Kansas City to arrange the deal and successfully came back with the license to manufacture and distribute Hallmark in the Philippines. It was on her kitchen table that the very first cards were planned. This was in 1973, the start of the Hallmark- NBS partnership. The next year, Hallmark cards made their appearance on the racks of National Book Store.

What followed were years of astounding growth and excellence. In product lines, from Christmas to everyday themes, more greeting cards and other excellent products have been added on each year to establish a full line of quality Hallmark merchandise.

Today, Filstar distributes to 1,000 outlets nationwide and has evolved to be a distributor of not just Hallmark, but of other products that supplement and enhance the personal expressions industry. The business holds its main office at Novaliches, Quezon City with branch offices based in Cavite (Carmona), Batangas (Tanauan) and Pampanga (San Fernando).

The company takes pride in the successful completion of multiple subdivisions in over two decades of operations. Through aggressive sales and marketing thrusts, it boasts of having expanded in areas like Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Rizal and Caloocan. As the housing needs of people continue to expand, augmented by low interest rate for housing loans, the potential sales and development of new housing projects for the Company is projected to rise in the future.

Serving as the moral fibre for all these activities is an excellent, vibrant workforce of more than 500, led by an equally dynamic Board composed of renowned businessmen.

Borland Development Corporation is a proud member of Subdivision & Housing Developers Association, Inc. (SHDA) and Chamber of Real Estate & Builders Association, Inc. <li>Loyalty - every 5 years of rendered service</li>

<li>Sick Leave &amp; Vacation Leave (unused will be converted into cash)</li>
<li>Health Card</li>
<li>Uniform (effective upon regularization)</li>
</ul>

<li>Recognition Day</li>

In 2006, Ramesh Trading changed its business type to Corporation as part of its efforts to improve itself in the new millennium coupled with the entry of the 3rd Generation now handling the business. After over 70 years of its existence, the company has successfully branched out its endeavors into importing, wholesaling and distributorship. In 2014, the Corporation moved to a bigger facility located in Pasay City which is in line with its expansion efforts. This will further improve the company's overall efficiency and effectiveness ratings and speed up its operations.

VST ECS Phils., Inc. is more than just a distribution company. Our name stands for dynamic growth, well-diversified products and solutions, strong brands, extensive channel network, efficient infrastructure, and professional workforce. We continue to embrace changes in our industry.

Since its inception in 1998, VST ECS Phils., Inc. has repeatedly updated its portfolio with new and leading-edge solutions. As a result, it has evolved into one of the recognized local IT distributors in the country offering a comprehensive line-up
of products, solutions, and services for multi-industries. Ranked in the Top 200 companies in the Philippines, VST ECS has continuously redefined and broadened its portfolio of products and services to fully address the evolving market needs.

Today, it boasts off an extensive array of solutions ranging from systems and peripherals, wired and wireless networks, security and communications, cloud and virtualization, multimedia and presentation, creative and CAD, mobility, cloud services, point-of-sale, automated data capture, structured-cabling, hyperconvergence, among others.

2020-11-06T05:54:31.514924+00:00 2020-12-30T16:00:00+00:00 false public-safety-mutual-benefit-fund-inc- The Public Safety Mutual Benefit Fund, Inc. (PSMBFI) is a duly registered non-stock, non-profit mutual benefit fund association, organized to provide insurance protection, and financial and material aid to its members.

PSMBFI is committed to provide life insurance coverage for public safety practitioners, both uniformed and civilian. With minimal requirements, PSMBFI immediately releases the cash advance to the beneficiaries to help pay for the member's funeral and burial expenses. Once all the requirements are completed, the full amount of insurance claims is immediately processed.

The association endeavors to continuously improve the benefits given and services rendered to its members. Furthermore, it remains steadfast in its commitment to fulfill its Corporate Social Responsibility Programs to its constituents.

As a financial institution, PSMBFI implements financial literacy programs to educate members from different public safety agencies nationwide.

The association has a strong membership base composed of the uniformed and civilian personnel from the following agencies/institutions:
* Philippine National Police
* National Police Commission
* Bureau of Fire Protection
* DOTC- Office of Transportation Security

In 2006, Ramesh Trading changed its business type to Corporation as part of its efforts to improve itself in the new millennium coupled with the entry of the 3rd Generation now handling the business. After over 70 years of its existence, the company has successfully branched out its endeavors into importing, wholesaling and distributorship. In 2014, the Corporation moved to a bigger facility located in Pasay City which is in line with its expansion efforts. This will further improve the company's overall efficiency and effectiveness ratings and speed up its operations.

In 2006, Ramesh Trading changed its business type to Corporation as part of its efforts to improve itself in the new millennium coupled with the entry of the 3rd Generation now handling the business. After over 70 years of its existence, the company has successfully branched out its endeavors into importing, wholesaling and distributorship. In 2014, the Corporation moved to a bigger facility located in Pasay City which is in line with its expansion efforts. 2020-11-09T06:48:27.182672+00:00 2021-01-29T16:00:00+00:00 false st-luke-s-medical-center-1 The foremost and the most admired hospital in the Philippines, St. Luke's Medical Center (SLMC) has provided high-quality healthcare for over a century.

It was founded in 1903 with a mission to provide outstanding out-patient care. Today it is the foremost and most admired hospital in the Philippines and an acknowledged leader in Asia.

St. Luke's delivers on its mission of healing by gathering under one roof the finest medical expertise, the most sophisticated medical technology and facilities, and a deep-rooted culture of compassion. It supports this mission with research and continuing education for those who serve. The total dedication to quality and caring of the St. Luke's family is what distinguishes the hospital as a center of healthcare excellence in Asia.

These centers of excellence bring to the Philippines the latest medical advances and treatment modalities. Over 1,700 hospital-affiliated medical consultants see out-patients in more than 450 private clinics.

SLMC is the undisputed leader in virtually all medical specialties, including cardiovascular medicine, neurology and neurosurgery, cancer, ophthalmology, and digestive and liver diseases. It is the first choice of medical and health-related practitioners and patients for executive check-ups.

SLMC receives patients from around Asia, Micronesia, the Middle East, Europe and the United States.

With its rich legacy of excellence and a second new and modern facility at the Fort Bonifacio Global City, SLMC is in a position to realize a bolder vision of the institution as one of the top five hospitals in Asia by 2010.		 20435 Hospital / Health Care https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/logos/WLFHZJPKKA846NPH3BFX6EGHK5LTDCA76TABZLSL-5ac579af.png St. Luke's Medical Center true true st-luke-s-medical-center-1 The foremost and the most admired hospital in the Philippines, St. Luke's Medical Center (SLMC) has provided high-quality healthcare for over a century.

<ul>
<li>Accomplish all assigned tasks by the management in a timely and effective manner as deemed necessary for the betterment of the organization as a whole.</li>
</ul>

<p> </p>

<p>Service Operations Management - Event &amp; Monitoring Management</p>

<ul>
<li>Monitor alert queue, health of security sensors and endpoint and collects data and context necessary to initiate Incident Response work</li>
<li>Monitor that endpoint security controls and up-to-date in terms on software version and escalate to Technology Management for those that needed updating/patching</li>
<li>Create tickets and ensure regular update to tickets is being performed.</li>
<li>Escalate to SOC Incident Responder (L2) items that has been categorized as actionable information security incidents.</li>
</ul>

<p> </p>

<p>Change Management </p>

<ul>
<li>Diligently monitor affected resources before, during and after a change is implemented.</li>
</ul>		 550 false 2020-11-09T09:21:39.464481+00:00 IT and Software 105 H.V. Dela Costa Makati Philippines Metro Manila 161458 false false SOC L1 Analyst 1 1 <p>A. Minimum Education</p>

<ul>
<li>Must be a graduate of Computer Studies/Computer Engineering/Information Technology/Electronics Engineering or equivalent</li>
</ul>

<p> </p>

<p>B. Minimum Experience/Training</p>

<p>Experience </p>

<ul>
<li>Have at least 1 years working experience in a SOC Operations environment OR have undergone TRENDS Cadetship Program</li>
</ul>

<p> </p>

<p>Training &amp; Certifications Requirement</p>

<ul>
<li>ITIL Foundation</li>
<li>CompTIA Security+</li>
<li>EC Council: Certified Ethical Hacker</li>
</ul>

<p> </p>

<p>C. Competency</p>

<p>Technical Skills </p>

<p>(N) IP Networking</p>

<p>(N) Monitoring Systems</p>

<p>(N) Network Troubleshooting</p>

<p>(N) System Troubleshooting</p>

<p>(F) Application/Web Programming</p>

<p>(F) ITIL</p>

<p>(F) Cybersecurity Fundamentals</p>

<p>(F) IDS/IPS penetration and vulnerability testing</p>

<p>(F) Firewall intrusion detection, prevention and protocols</p>

<p>(F) Secure coding practices, ethical hacking and threat modeling</p>

<p>(F) Identity and access manager principles</p>

<p>(F) Application security and encryption technologies</p>

<p>(F) Secure Network Architecture</p>

<p>(F) Advanced Persistent Threats (APT), phishing and social engineering, network access, controllers, anti-malware and enhanced authentication</p>

<p> </p>

<p>(F) - Familiar / 0-12 months</p>

<p>(N) - Novice / 1-2 years</p>

<p>(I) - Intermediate / 3-4 years</p>

<p>(A) - Advanced / &gt; 5 years</p>

<p> </p>

<p>* Waived for Trends cadetship graduates</p>

<p> </p>

<p>Communication Skills </p>

<p>(N) Speaks clearly and can be easily understood.</p>

<p>(N) Expresses &amp; speaks ideas in a logical and organized sequence.</p>

<p>(I) Writes clearly, concisely and effectively.</p>

<p>(I) Expresses ideas in a logical and organized sequence in written form.</p>

<p> </p>

<p>(F) - Familiar / 0-12 months</p>

<p>(N) - Novice / 1-2 years</p>

<p>(I) - Intermediate / 3-4 years</p>

<p>(A) - Advanced / &gt; 5 years</p>

<p> </p>

<p>Abilities </p>

<ul>
<li>Must work well under pressure</li>
<li>Must have good interpersonal skills</li>
<li>Must be pro-active when identifying potential issues</li>
<li>Must show good customer management skills</li>
</ul>		 63.63636363636363 true soc-l1-analyst Full time public 200

2020-11-09T03:38:27.260166+00:00 2020-11-14T16:00:00+00:00 false ramesh-trading-corporation-1 RAMESH TRADING was founded in 1948 as a General Merchandise Store and as the years went by became an importer, distributor, and wholesaler of general merchandise.

In 2006, Ramesh Trading changed its business type to Corporation as part of its efforts to improve itself in the new millennium coupled with the entry of the 3rd Generation now handling the business. After over 70 years of its existence, the company has successfully branched out its endeavors into importing, wholesaling and distributorship. In 2014, the Corporation moved to a bigger facility located in Pasay City which is in line with its expansion efforts. This will further improve the company's overall efficiency and effectiveness ratings and speed up its operations.

With the company's vision of supplying every room in every household in the Philippines, we continue to deliver quality goods and services to our customers. We have branched out with our professional line of products and have also been supplying Hotels, Restaurants, Caterers, Cafes and Culinary Schools with our Industrial Grade products.

<ul>
<li>Expert in all functional test phases and activities. Control product quality by ensuring all key resources provide quality test results.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Roles and Responsibilities</strong></p>

<p><strong>1. As a project lead:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Lead QA effort estimation, requirement analysis, and test planning</li>
<li>Request and follow up necessary environment/mall configuration from stakeholders</li>
<li>Track requirement changes, and strategize when they affect timeline and quality</li>
<li>Organize all test documents and project tickets for better tracking and auditing</li>
<li>Ensure all pre-testing and testing activities are accomplished per deployment</li>
<li>Perform quality checkpoint by ensuring sanity/smoke testing passed both in QA and Production Server before accepting the build from developers</li>
<li>Conduct usability testing</li>
<li>Manage and delegate retesting, regression, and integration activities</li>
<li>If automation is implemented, run the automation suite</li>
<li>Create bug or improvement JIRA tickets when an anomaly is found in the product</li>
<li>Manage the overall distribution process including sending of release notice and maintaining Distribution and Version dashboards</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>2. As a leader to your subordinates:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Review QA effort estimation, test plan, high-level test scenarios, and data mapping</li>
<li>Conduct exploratory testing</li>
<li>Monitoring and controlling process and project compliance to quality and timeline</li>
<li>Setup, plan, and track automation activities and progress</li>
<li>Delegates and monitors projects of experienced testers</li>
<li>Evaluates the performance of experienced testers</li>
<li>Provides training to his subordinates and to the new hires</li>
</ul>		 550 false 2020-11-09T05:26:35.423179+00:00 IT and Software Mandaluyong Philippines Metro Manila 140897 false false 60000 Senior Test Engineer 5 med_ins sick_leave family_leave paid_holidays paid_leave mat_pat_leave 1 <ul>

2020-11-06T05:57:01.489747+00:00 2020-12-30T16:00:00+00:00 false public-safety-mutual-benefit-fund-inc- The Public Safety Mutual Benefit Fund, Inc. (PSMBFI) is a duly registered non-stock, non-profit mutual benefit fund association, organized to provide insurance protection, and financial and material aid to its members.

PSMBFI is committed to provide life insurance coverage for public safety practitioners, both uniformed and civilian. With minimal requirements, PSMBFI immediately releases the cash advance to the beneficiaries to help pay for the member's funeral and burial expenses. Once all the requirements are completed, the full amount of insurance claims is immediately processed.

The association endeavors to continuously improve the benefits given and services rendered to its members. Furthermore, it remains steadfast in its commitment to fulfill its Corporate Social Responsibility Programs to its constituents.

As a financial institution, PSMBFI implements financial literacy programs to educate members from different public safety agencies nationwide.

The association has a strong membership base composed of the uniformed and civilian personnel from the following agencies/institutions:
* Philippine National Police
* National Police Commission
* Bureau of Fire Protection
* DOTC- Office of Transportation Security
* Philippine National Police Academy
* Philippine Coast Guard

<p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p>

In 2006, Ramesh Trading changed its business type to Corporation as part of its efforts to improve itself in the new millennium coupled with the entry of the 3rd Generation now handling the business. After over 70 years of its existence, the company has successfully branched out its endeavors into importing, wholesaling and distributorship. In 2014, the Corporation moved to a bigger facility located in Pasay City which is in line with its expansion efforts. Since 2011, over 10,000+ jobseekers found their job through ACES!

CHOICES Comprehensive Active Jobs

Choose from the 20+ Top Call Centers, 150+ locations, 800+ positions, 10,000+ vacancies. There is a perfect job for you in ACES. In ACES, we only endorse you to clients that you have the highest chance of getting hired. Come during our ACES Days and get Hired On The Spot (HOTS)

Since 2011, ACES has consistently been awarded as the Top 3 Recruitment Partner of choice of the Biggest BPOs and Call Centers.

Since 2011, ACES has given over 30,000,000.00 (Thirty million) worth of SODEXO Gift Checks to thousands of jobseekers hired through ACES.

2020-11-09T03:23:16.349457+00:00 2020-11-19T16:00:00+00:00 false ramesh-trading-corporation-1 RAMESH TRADING was founded in 1948 as a General Merchandise Store and as the years went by became an importer, distributor, and wholesaler of general merchandise.

In 2006, Ramesh Trading changed its business type to Corporation as part of its efforts to improve itself in the new millennium coupled with the entry of the 3rd Generation now handling the business. After over 70 years of its existence, the company has successfully branched out its endeavors into importing, wholesaling and distributorship. In 2014, the Corporation moved to a bigger facility located in Pasay City which is in line with its expansion efforts. This will further improve the company's overall efficiency and effectiveness ratings and speed up its operations.

With the company's vision of supplying every room in every household in the Philippines, we continue to deliver quality goods and services to our customers. We have branched out with our professional line of products and have also been supplying Hotels, Restaurants, Caterers, Cafes and Culinary Schools with our Industrial Grade products.

- Industrial chemicals

History

Our years of first-hand frontline experience in the marketplace, know-how in sourcing from manufacturers and traders world-wide, and European Management with Oriental Expertise provide both, suppliers and clients, with a reliable partner for a long-term business relationship and mutual benefit.

WHY JOIN US?

Rudolf Lietz Inc. recognizes how strong work performance makes the company successful.

One way to accomplish this is to offer a comprehensive benefit program designed to meet your basic and life-changing benefit needs. From full medical coverage to generous paid holidays and vacations. RLI's package is consistently and continually being assessed to ensure competitiveness.

Cultures and Values

Rudolf Lietz Inc. is a German-Filipino company located at Paranaque City, Philippines. Our culture follows that of similar German companies where we take pride on being organised, working to the book and executing high quality work. It is of utmost importance to stay not just one but several steps ahead of the competition but doing so through the quality of work. We also invite our team members to be creative with the work they do often working in smaller teams to solve much bigger problem.

The Senior Windows Systems Administrator will be responsible for installing, configuring, and maintaining operating system workstations and servers, including web servers, in support of business processing requirements. Performs software installations and upgrades to operating systems and layered software packages. Schedules installations and upgrades and maintains them in accordance with established IT policies and procedures. Monitors and tunes the system to achieve optimum performance levels. Develops and maintains a comprehensive operating system hardware and software configuration database/library of all supporting documentation.</p>

➢ Assist in application deployment, migration, and security updates to ensure minimal down<br>
time for banking applications<br>
➢ Deploy and maintain Windows 2008/2012/2016 servers and applications in an enterprise data center environment. Audit Windows Server Environment. Thorough knowledge of Windows server management tools.<br>
➢ Thorough knowledge of Active Directory.<br>
➢ Knowledge of virtual environments (VMware and Hyper-V).<br>

<li>Helping prepare for trial by organizing exhibits and assisting with other tasks as needed</li>
<li>Prepare briefs, wills, contracts, pleadings, appeals, and other legal documents.</li>
<li>Gathering and analyzing statutes, decisions, and legal articles, codes, documents and other data.</li>
<li>Calling on witnesses to testify at hearings</li>
<li>Keeping law library up-to-date by monitoring legal volumes</li>
</ul>		 650 false 2020-11-07T01:11:52.509755+00:00 Legal 74b, Panay Ave, Paligsahan Quezon City Philippines Metro Manila 163013 false false Paralegal Officer 1 1 <ul>

In 2006, Ramesh Trading changed its business type to Corporation as part of its efforts to improve itself in the new millennium coupled with the entry of the 3rd Generation now handling the business. After over 70 years of its existence, the company has successfully branched out its endeavors into importing, wholesaling and distributorship. In 2014, the Corporation moved to a bigger facility located in Pasay City which is in line with its expansion efforts. This will further improve the company's overall efficiency and effectiveness ratings and speed up its operations.

2020-11-03T07:46:57.976554+00:00 2020-12-30T16:00:00+00:00 false coins-ph At Coins.ph, we give people the freedom to use their money the way they want.

Over half of the population in South East Asia is un-served by traditional banks and left to transact in cash leaving them exposed to high remittance fees, high-interest loans, and unable to save, invest, or build credit. We believe that everyone deserves access to financial services regardless of having a bank account or credit card.

Coins.ph uses digital currency and mobile phones to increase accessibility and reduce the cost of driving financial services to customers - bridging the gap between the banks and the unbanked.

<p><strong>The Location:</strong> Silver City 2, Pasig City</p>

<p><strong>The Impact:</strong> The Procurement Lead role is responsible for delivering and supporting global sourcing events (RFP’s, RFI’s and direct negotiations) across +$600m of S&amp;P Global indirect spend categories including Professional Services, HR, IT Services, Travel, Meetings &amp; Conferences, Enterprise Services, Marketing, Sales and Telecoms. The Procurement Lead will assist Global Category Managers (GCM) and Regional Sourcing Managers (RSM’s) with sourcing, negotiating, contracting and implementing global suppliers as part of the execution of global category strategies.</p>

<p>The primary objective of the selected individual will be to achieve the best total value in sourcing, including cost reductions, while establishing strong partnerships with core product and service providers.</p>

<p><strong>The Team:</strong> You will be part of the growing Procurement Operations team in Manila under the Global Business Team.</p>

<p><strong>What's in it for you:</strong> This is an exciting role with broad responsibilities and the opportunity to grow and take on increasing levels of responsibility. The successful candidate will be joining a growing Procurement department on an exciting path towards world class standards and the Procurement Lead will be part of a strategy to advance the procurement maturity of the broader Procurement function within S&amp;P Global.</p>

<p> </p>

<p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p>

<p><strong>Strategy and Planning:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Partner with Global Category Managers (GCM’s) and Regional Sourcing Managers (RSM’s) to create and execute sourcing plans in alignment with category sourcing strategies.</li>
<li>Develop on-going relationships with strategic vendors and functional/division stakeholders</li>
<li>Engage and coordinate with functional subject matter experts, such as legal, tax, finance, risk, etc., in support of procurement initiatives</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Sourcing:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Drive efforts in continuous improvement sourcing approach and identify and execute performance improvement initiatives aimed at achieving year-on-year reductions in S&amp;P Global’s procurement efficiency ratio. Develop/drive sourcing strategies for each of the items or services within a spend category through vendor negotiations, process improvements, and compliance.</li>
<li>Own and deliver structured sourcing events (RFP’s, RFQ’s and RFI’s, negotiations etc) to source and implement suppliers. Evaluate and rate suppliers, ensuring integrity of the request for proposal process.</li>
<li>Conduct negotiations and oversee administration of contracts within assigned spend categories ensuring appropriate contractual clauses are in place to minimize Company’s risk.</li>
<li>Perform commercial negotiations and facilitate contracting process</li>
<li>Develop a Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) model and benefits tracking approach to be used during key sourcing events</li>
<li>Generate market intelligence and vendor assessment reports and leveraging applicable information for all category planning and sourcing activities</li>
<li>Ensure GCM and RSM are aware of cultural, political, legal and social challenges that may exist, and provide support in overcoming these challenges.</li>
<li>Coordinate financial impact with divisions/functions and Finance</li>
<li>Understand and communicate key commercial risks in procurement</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Category Management:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Support in the creation and execution of category management plans and category sourcing strategies</li>
<li>Identify and champion cost and demand management opportunities to drive procurement value</li>
<li>Lead and coordinate cross-functional deal teams established to drive value in the sourcing event</li>
<li>Recommend and participates in the development of relevant category policies and procedures</li>
<li>Identification and realization of cost-saving and cost-reduction opportunities</li>
<li>Vendor Management:</li>
<li>Working with GCM’s and VMO on management of global suppliers</li>
<li>Responsible for managing assigned suppliers including:</li>
<li>Performing vendor reviews and scorecards, including QBR’s</li>
<li>Issue resolution and SLA tracking</li>
<li>Annual objectives and service improvement initiatives</li>
<li>Ownership of supplier tools and processes</li>
<li>Payment of relevant supplier invoices</li>
<li>Monitor and manage contract renewal and expiration to ensure sufficient time for renegotiation, termination and conversion to new supplier as desired by the business unit.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Benchmarking and Research:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Conduct market analysis/ Gather market intelligence</li>
<li>Develop RFx summaries and vendor evaluation matrices for engagement/vendor managers to evaluate vendor responses</li>
<li>Provide competitive benchmarking by applying procurement and contract best practices; effectively search and utilize industry and market insights</li>
</ul>		 550 true 2020-11-09T09:22:05.334489+00:00 Supply Chain GF, Frontera Drive, Pasig, Metro Manila, Philippines Pasig Philippines Metro Manila 161242 false false Global Procurement Sourcing Analyst 1 paid_holidays med_ins sick_leave perf_bonus family_leave life_ins paid_leave 1 <ul>

<li>Minimum of 3 years in a professional procurement function with a focus on multiple categories</li>
<li>Proven and demonstrable experience sourcing across multiple Categories including the ability to negotiate complex decisions. Must be able to provide multiple examples of prior experience running sourcing events (RFP’s, RFI’s and direct negotiation) and delivering cost savings</li>
<li>Demonstrable experience in building strategic partnerships both internally and externally with key stakeholders and vendors with deep knowledge of vendors and trends to inform category planning</li>
<li>Must have experiencing using e-Sourcing tools (e.g. Ariba, Scout, Coupa, Ivalua etc.)</li>
<li>Must be fluent English language speaker. Superior oral and written communication and presentation skills.</li>

<p>Understands &amp; analyzes business problems and needs; Translates, captures and documents requirements, providing high level solutions that leverage product capabilities and best practices in order to produce optimal technology solutions.</p>

<p>Key responsibilities</p>

<ul>
<li>Analyzes and documents business and technical requirements that best reflect customer needs; Translates the requirements into prioritize epics/features, supporting the release and iteration planning.</li>
<li>Advises customers based on product capabilities and best practices, leveraging reuse and ensuring high business value</li>
<li>Provides and designs, based on pre-defined solution architecture, an integrated high-level solution that fit customer's business &amp; operational needs.</li>
<li>Effectively participates in and/or leads formal and informal reviews with stakeholders, applying knowledge and experience and providing technical perspective and support; Performs demonstrations of solutions to users.</li>
<li>Support development teams during the iterations (provide business clarifications, adjustment to risks, change in scope, reprioritize and approve “done” stories and features during demo’s).</li>
<li>Responsible for communicating the solution to customers' business and/ or IT personnel, explaining the details of new solutions and their impact on business processes and ensuring that the customer understands the solution.</li>
<li>Follows up on solution design issues in his/her domain until solution is signed off and supports the resolution of configuration/ implementation-related issues if and when they arise (for example, overseeing ordering processes across various customer types and products, leading all product catalogue models and designs, etc.).</li>
<li>Prepares solution-related documents and specifications; May also configure the solution, and create, execute and maintain test plans when applicable.</li>
<li>Identifies product gaps and recommends enhancements to the product core team</li>
</ul>		 550 false 2020-11-09T08:22:43.198340+00:00 IT and Software Cityland 10 Tower 2, 154 H.V Dela Costa St. Corner Valero, Bel-air, Makati City Taguig Philippines Metro Manila 121959 false false Business Analyst 1 1 <ul>

<p><br>
· Receives and responds to customers’ inquiries/complaints through phone, in order to take orders following the standards set for call management, call accuracy, call handling and data encoding accuracy.<br>

· Keep records of customer interactions and transactions, recording details of inquiries, complaints, and comments, as well as actions taken.<br>

· Refer unresolved customer grievances to designated departments for further investigation.<br>
· Managed follow up calls to customers in a timely manner.<br>
· Coordinating well with other departments.<br>
