<p>1. Conduct Compliance review on the controls implementation and regulatory risks within the business units.</p>

<ul>
<li>Oversee completion of business units of the Compliance Self-Asessment Matrix and reporting of the results to the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) and CIMB Bank Philipippines Senior Management.</li>
<li>Work closely with the DCOROs and HODs of respective business units in conducting independent testing to oversee effectiveness of controls and access inherent compliance risks.</li>
<li>Ensure implementation of the Annual Compliance Risk Asessement Methodology.</li>
</ul>

<p>2. Manage and monitor compliance breaches/potential suspected non-compliance or any irregularities to the regulation.</p>

<ul>
<li>Coordinate with business units in conducting root cause and impact analysis of identified regulatory and AML/CFT breaches.</li>
<li>Monitor and ensure that the business units has taken/will take appropriate remidial actions and establish preventive measures to avoid recurrence.</li>
</ul>

<p>3. Ensure timely and accurate reporting of AML/CFT related reports</p>

<ul>
<li>
<p>Coordinates with the concerned business units of the timely preparation of the suspicious transaction report.</p>
</li>
<li>Reviews STRs prepared and revise, if necessary, to ensure that information is complete and in accordance to AMLC’s reporting standards and transmits the final STR through the AMLC portal after securing the AML/CFT Committee’s approval.</li>
<li>Ensure the accurate, complete and tinmely reporting of covered and suspisious transactions, reports on crimes and losses, and handling of AML-related court cases (i.e. Freeze Orders)</li>
</ul>

<p><br>
4. Ensure prompt and appropriate disposition of alerts generated through AML Detica System</p>

<ul>
<li>Periodically review alerts to determine if there are generated in accordance to the defined parameters and thresholds.</li>
<li>Conduct root cause analysis of any concerns emanating from the review and recommend appropriate system enhancements to resolve alert issues.</li>
<li>Review the alerts generated and conduct preliminary assessment and verification on the transactions.</li>
<li>Dispose transaction alerts promptly and document action taken based on verification conducted.</li>
</ul>

<p>5. Manages and analyses customer data, transaction details and other available data to provide comprehensive management reports.</p>

<p>6. Promote a culture of compliance awareness</p>

<ul>
<li>Assist the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) to strategize and plan to promote AML/CFT compliance culture across CIMB Bank Philippines.</li>
</ul>		 550 false 2020-11-09T07:56:29.959094+00:00 Legal 31st Street Taguig Philippines Metro Manila 162076 false false Compliance Manager 1 1 <p><u><strong>Qualifications:</strong></u></p>

<p>6) Analyze and judge industry data to support sales decisions</p>

<p>Career Planning:</p>

<p>1) Year 1: Mainly responsible for product /MI related work</p>

<p>2) Year 2-year 3: Responsible for product/MI-related work, training product MI-related candidates, starting to be responsible for product operation, assisting the person in charge of GTM to conduct overall product operation and be responsible for model product</p>

<p>3) Year 3 and above: The person in charge of GTM department reserves personnel or praises the horizontal development of the department</p>		 550 false 2020-11-09T08:17:36.792241+00:00 Sales and Marketing Taguig Philippines Metro Manila 163550 false false Product Manager | Chinese 1 1 <p>Job Requirements:</p>

<p>3) Educational background: bachelor degree or above in science and engineering</p>

<p>4) Language: English as the working language</p>

2020-11-06T03:33:55.603977+00:00 2021-01-04T16:00:00+00:00 false ateneo-de-manila-university-1 The Ateneo de Manila University (Ateneo) is one of the leading universities in the Philippines. More than 150 years in existence, the Ateneo has grown into a major Jesuit institution. Officially it became a university in 1959. It offers over 100 academic degree programmes.

Ateneo offers Basic Education (Grade School, Junior and Senior High School). In addition, the Loyola Schools (college) is made up of four schools (Social Sciences; Humanities; Science and Engineering; and Management) that offer graduate and undergraduate degrees, with a total enrolment of about 10,000 students per year. The Ateneo has 4 professional schools located in 3 campuses in Quezon City, Makati City and Pasig City (Business; Government; Law; and Medicine and Public Health), with about 4,000 professional postgraduate students.

It has an array of research centres, 11 of which are recognized as Centres of Excellence by the Philippine Commission on Higher Education. In addition to a European Studies Programme, it has a Centre for Asian Studies that fosters comparative research on East and Southeast Asia.

The Ateneo has 207 partnerships with universities around the world (82 in Europe, 87 in Asia, 11 in Australia and New Zealand, and 27 in North and South America) and is a member of the ASEAN Universities Network and 3 other international university networks. The Ateneo’s Rizal Library is the most advanced in the Philippines with over 307,000 titles in its collection and online access to most major academic journals.		 24711 Higher Education / Academia https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/logos/X6KJXKFD6EKSQTPK7MF39JWKXV9X6KN8JHGYEYR9-5a7e35a7.jpg Ateneo de Manila University true true ateneo-de-manila-university-1 The Ateneo de Manila University (Ateneo) is one of the leading universities in the Philippines. The HR Officer shall also assist in looking after the internal quality measures of the Office of the Human Resource Management and Organization Development’s (OHRMOD) systems, processes, and capabilities.</p>

<p><strong>Main Duties and Responsibilities</strong></p>

<p><strong>I. Organization Diagnoses and Intervention</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Keeps abreast of organization advancements, taking a special interest in organization design, process improvements, capability development, change management, and succession management.</li>
<li>Assists in conducting organization need assessment, utilizing the most appropriate data gathering and validation methodologies.
<ul>
<li>Drafts an organization assessment plan, after due consultation and understanding of the needs of the client.</li>
<li>Drafts questionnaires and/or data gathering guides to facilitate the sessions.</li>
<li>Assists in the actual conduct of data gathering, from the administration of questionnaires to facilitation of sessions.</li>
<li>Assists in designing various processes including organizational charts and process flow to understand and document the work of the unit.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Comes up with an initial analysis based on data gathered from the unit, its stakeholders, and other relevant sources.</li>
<li>Assists in designing organization development (OD) interventions and evaluation processes to address gaps determined in the organizational diagnosis phase. </li>
<li>Carries out OD interventions and initiatives (i.e. competency development, systems review and improvement, change management, succession planning, process re-engineering, etc.) as assigned by the Organization Capability and Succession Section Head.
<ul>
<li>Assists in monitoring, coordinating, implementing, and evaluating organization development projects, keeping track of the deliverables, timelines, and agreements</li>
<li>(Co)Facilitates individual and group discussions, and workshops towards the achievement of the required process.</li>
<li>Proposes action points and process improvements, based on what is applicable and realistic given the unit’s context.</li>
<li>Assists the Workforce Strategy &amp; Branding (WSB) Section and the Career &amp; Learning Development (CLD) in carrying out needed interventions.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>II. Organization and Job Design</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Assists in reviewing the effectiveness of an organizational unit, proposing job designs, processes, and systems that can bring about optimal results for the unit to achieve its mandates, based on the inputs gathered from its stakeholders and data from industry practices. </li>
<li>Works with the Workforce Strategy and Branding Section in ensuring that all job levels accurately reflect the worth of the jobs, that proper classification and nomenclatures are followed.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>III. Talent Development and Succession</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Researches on talent development and succession systems within and among the academic community and other industries.</li>
<li>Benchmarks best practices in employee learning and development that cover frameworks, assessment strategies, development of interventions, implementation, and evaluation systems.</li>
<li>Assists in monitoring qualification standards and competencies for different job families and job classification.
<ul>
<li>Assists in identifying and developing talent identification criteria.</li>
<li>Assists in the design (review and update) of talent development and succession systems and interventions.</li>
<li>Assists in the conduct and evaluation of the talent development programs.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Assists in communicating and marketing the University’s talent development and succession program to unit heads and employees.
<ul>
<li>Monitors talent development and succession planning initiatives and projects and provides updates on a monthly basis on the status of such initiatives.</li>
<li>Assists in driving a culture that supports continuous improvement in talent development and succession.</li>
<li>Monitors employee profiles and capability development with the Career and Learning Development Section, tracking employees with the potential to take on leadership positions.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Conducts data gathering and consultations with key stakeholders in the design of learning programs for talents and leaders.
<ul>
<li>Coordinates the development of systematic learning interventions that are aligned with the organization’s and balanced with the individual needs.</li>
<li>Assists in coordinating, organizing, and evaluating the talent development and succession programs for potential and incumbent leaders, and unit administrators.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<p>IV. <strong>OHRMOD-Specific</strong>: <strong>Quality Review</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Assists in reviewing OHRMOD’s processes, systems, and practices to ensure operational efficiency and effective delivery of services.</li>
<li>Assists in monitoring the achievement of OHRMOD’s goals.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>V. HR Partnering</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Keeps track of updates and developments that affect the University as an organization, including its employees.</li>
<li>Keeps abreast of trends and changes happening in the University and with the client.</li>
<li>Manages and maintains relationships with clients.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>VI. Administrative Functions</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Assists in monitoring, coordinating, implementing, and evaluating all the Section’s projects, keeping track of the deliverables, timelines, agreements, including possible sustainability measures.
<ul>
<li>Ensures all accountabilities are delivered, including payments to suppliers and contractors.</li>
<li>Recommends improvements in the Section’s systems, processes, and programs.</li>
<li>Assists in budgeting for the Section’s operational requirements.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Assists in communicating the programs of the Section to unit heads and employees.</li>
<li>Manages and keeps the project team abreast of developments, when necessary.</li>
<li>Oversees the coordination, logistical, and resource requirements of the Section’s projects and activities.</li>
<li>Documents all meetings, proceedings, and events of the Section’s projects and activities.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>VII. Performs all other duties as may be reasonably required of the position, in accordance with the instructions of the Immediate Supervisor, and it's duly authorized representative.</strong></p>		 550 false 2020-11-09T05:17:43.814462+00:00 Human Resources Katipunan Loyola Heights Quezon City Philippines Metro Manila 163807 false false HR Officer | Organization Capability and Succession Section 1 1 <p><strong>Education and Experience Requirements</strong> </p>

<ul>

<li>Two (2) year experience in facilitating learning programs</li>
<li>At least two (2) year experience in succession planning and organizational development administration</li>

<li>Critical and analytical thinking, ability to connect and see the implications of actions to other systems/processes</li>

<li>Strong attention to detail</li>
<li>Ability to innovate and open to learning</li>
<li>Must be comfortable handling ambiguity, flexible, adaptable, and proactive</li>
<li>Strong knowledge on presentations and several MS applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Visio etc.), creating various reports in Excel</li>
<li>Has a strong sense of urgency balanced with quality-result orientation</li>

(CPI) is a 32-year-old company with a long and successful history providing software development services and solutions to the insurance industry. CPI has also recently launched eLIFE, to support the operations of life insurance companies with a fully-integrated, web-based application.

2020-11-05T05:21:08.622269+00:00 2021-02-27T16:00:00+00:00 false sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

SKY Cable Corporation is the pay television and broadband arm of ABS-CBN, the Philippines’ leading media and entertainment company.

Since introducing cable television to Filipinos in 1990, it has become a frontrunner in pay TV and broadband services that offer rich content that entertain, educate, inspire, and offer experiences to Filipinos, whom it considers as its Kapamilyas.

Today, it serves Filipinos through various products under SKYdirect, SKY Fiber, and SKYcable.

SKYcable is a Pay TV service offering HD cable TV with top-notch programming and the widest selection of channels on offer by any cable provider; and SKY Fiber, a high-speed broadband for the home and beyond.

SKYdirect, now in over one million homes nationwide, brings SKY’s superior brand of cable entertainment options to more areas, beyond the urban centers via direct-to-home television technology.

SKY serves the business community through SKYBIZ, Its corporate and commercial arm, which delivers content (SKYcable) and connectivity (SKY Fiber) services to any business of any size.		 17061 Cable and Telecommunications https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/www.kalibrr.com/logos/YRBMYTQF3DTVF5CA8X8H3R9YA46P7R77P2BYHV97-5e4e207b.png Sky Cable Corporation false true sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

2020-11-06T05:56:06.618235+00:00 2020-12-30T16:00:00+00:00 false public-safety-mutual-benefit-fund-inc- The Public Safety Mutual Benefit Fund, Inc. (PSMBFI) is a duly registered non-stock, non-profit mutual benefit fund association, organized to provide insurance protection, and financial and material aid to its members.

PSMBFI is committed to provide life insurance coverage for public safety practitioners, both uniformed and civilian. With minimal requirements, PSMBFI immediately releases the cash advance to the beneficiaries to help pay for the member's funeral and burial expenses. Once all the requirements are completed, the full amount of insurance claims is immediately processed.

The association endeavors to continuously improve the benefits given and services rendered to its members. Furthermore, it remains steadfast in its commitment to fulfill its Corporate Social Responsibility Programs to its constituents.

As a financial institution, PSMBFI implements financial literacy programs to educate members from different public safety agencies nationwide.

The association has a strong membership base composed of the uniformed and civilian personnel from the following agencies/institutions:
* Philippine National Police
* National Police Commission
* Bureau of Fire Protection
* DOTC- Office of Transportation Security
* Philippine National Police Academy
* Philippine Coast Guard
* National Mapping and Resource
Information Authority
* Metropolitan Manila Development
Authority (MMDA)
* Philippine Public Safety College
* Department of Environment and Natural
Resources
* Bureau of Immigration
* Land Transportation Office (LTO)		 3200 Insurance https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/logos/FHADERWP5Z88XNJVVQ4A-5a3b70e3.png Public Safety Mutual Benefit Fund, Inc. true true public-safety-mutual-benefit-fund-inc- The Public Safety Mutual Benefit Fund, Inc. (PSMBFI) is a duly registered non-stock, non-profit mutual benefit fund association, organized to provide insurance protection, and financial and material aid to its members.

PSMBFI is committed to provide life insurance coverage for public safety practitioners, both uniformed and civilian. With minimal requirements, PSMBFI immediately releases the cash advance to the beneficiaries to help pay for the member's funeral and burial expenses. Once all the requirements are completed, the full amount of insurance claims is immediately processed.

The association endeavors to continuously improve the benefits given and services rendered to its members. Furthermore, it remains steadfast in its commitment to fulfill its Corporate Social Responsibility Programs to its constituents.

As a financial institution, PSMBFI implements financial literacy programs to educate members from different public safety agencies nationwide.

2020-10-20T02:40:24.793582+00:00 2021-03-30T16:00:00+00:00 false sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

SKY Cable Corporation is the pay television and broadband arm of ABS-CBN, the Philippines’ leading media and entertainment company.

Since introducing cable television to Filipinos in 1990, it has become a frontrunner in pay TV and broadband services that offer rich content that entertain, educate, inspire, and offer experiences to Filipinos, whom it considers as its Kapamilyas.

Today, it serves Filipinos through various products under SKYdirect, SKY Fiber, and SKYcable.

SKYcable is a Pay TV service offering HD cable TV with top-notch programming and the widest selection of channels on offer by any cable provider; and SKY Fiber, a high-speed broadband for the home and beyond.

SKYdirect, now in over one million homes nationwide, brings SKY’s superior brand of cable entertainment options to more areas, beyond the urban centers via direct-to-home television technology.

SKY serves the business community through SKYBIZ, Its corporate and commercial arm, which delivers content (SKYcable) and connectivity (SKY Fiber) services to any business of any size.		 17061 Cable and Telecommunications https://rec-data.kalibrr.com/www.kalibrr.com/logos/YRBMYTQF3DTVF5CA8X8H3R9YA46P7R77P2BYHV97-5e4e207b.png Sky Cable Corporation false true sky-cable-corporation ABOUT SKY

We offer best of breed solutions from IT infrastructure to business applications, built on world class technology companies and supported by our certified technical team with proven Filipino expertise and skills available in the country today.

In 1990, Questronix was appointed by IBM as its first business partner for IBM UNIX platform and the company evolved in providing end-to-end solutions that run on IBM technology. After a decade of investment, skills and commitment in working with IBM, Questronix was awarded the Premier Business Partner status, making our company the first Business Partner in the country to be elevated to this exclusive circle.

Our methodology on selecting our technology partners and implementation team for our services ecosystem allows us to deliver consulting-led systems integration focused on open standards, interoperability and proven best practices that result in higher project success rates.

<p>The Team: Our team is responsible for providing clients world class product support and research. We are the pioneer team for Capital IQ Product Operations in Manila. We value excellence in our work as well as effective collaboration. These enable us to provide top notch support experience to our global clients.</p>

<p><strong>The Impact: </strong>The team is crucial in ensuring that clients maximize our products’ value. We are responsible for relaying client feedback to our internal teams who maintain product quality and provide insights into the client and market demand.</p>

<p><strong>What’s in it for you:</strong> The role provides two pivotal advantages to you.</p>

<p>The role will require you to become an effective communicator as you will be talking to different types of people. You will learn how to communicate solutions effectively while becoming critical in understanding problems and in identifying solutions in order to give the best possible support to our clients. The role will develop your industry and data expertise. You are responsible for answering inquiries heavily related to the finance industry and our product. This can develop your industry knowledge and gain expertise with not just the market, but also the data that we provide. Our platform is a product of combined expertise from the technology and finance industries. You will be trained to answer finance related inquiries in connection to the product which will expose you to understanding data architecture and the finance industry itself.</p>

<p>We pride ourselves in helping our employees attain their career aspirations and reach their full potential. We value employee development and provide trainings that will hone both soft and hard skills as you go along with your career with us.</p>

<p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong> The CIQ Client Services Team Manila is responsible for the following:</p>

<p><strong>Strategy and Capability</strong></p>

<p>• Plan and coordinate activities day-to-day/month-to-month to achieve results as per project schedule and key milestones</p>

<p><strong>Growth and Innovation</strong></p>

<p>• Partner in the development and deployment of innovation and continuous improvement</p>

<p><strong>Operational Excellence</strong></p>

<p>• Ensure own work and that of other contributors is to the defined standard</p>

<p><strong>Maximising Profitability and Return on Capital</strong></p>

LTD | Philippine Branch http://www.refinitiv.com Refinitiv Asia PTE. LTD | Philippine Branch 2020-10-26T14:37:08.297357+00:00 <p><strong>Job Description</strong>:</p>

<p><br>
The objective of the Global Business Consulting Group (“GBC) is to build an industry-leading Excel and Microsoft Office applications support group which provides a crucial driven advantage in the marketplace. The primary responsibilities are to focus on providing premium level consulting services using workflow efficiency tools for Capital Market &amp; Advisory clients. (moved from Responsibilities)</p>

<p>Combining a detailed understanding of finance and technology and an expertise in the product offerings, the role will focus on complex interactions with our clients in customising Eikon desktop views and building and modifying financial models in Excel using databases.</p>

<p>Globally, GBC provides 24/7 premium-level pre- and post-sales consultative support to AIM (Advisory &amp; Investment Management) clients across several Excel Add-in products and Desktop Product.</p>

<p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Provide high quality, consistent, end-to-end customer experience in the use and interpretation of our products and data; this includes product demonstrations and client training conducted both on-site and remotely</li>
<li>Construction of detailed spreadsheets and Excel models that support client research and analysis activities</li>
<li>Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction, focusing on quality and expertise.</li>
<li>Consistently upgrade your knowledge base and product expertise in order to constantly improve overall client experience for demos, trainings and support</li>
<li>Review sales opportunities with account managers and assigned salespeople</li>
<li>Collaborate closely with and maintain a consistent dialogue with Account and Sales teams to ensure a coordinated approach to beneficial support services, with a particular emphasis on global investment banks and investment management firms</li>
<li>Consolidate customer feedback on data and products to Business and Product owners to influence product evolution toward best meeting client needs</li>
<li>Working with the technical teams to test and validate product installations</li>
<li>Responsible for answering client queries via phone queue and shared email inbox, particularly during times of high volumes/unusual resources</li>
<li>Coordinate with the other Consultants and internal teams to maintain a global structure during roll-outs.</li>
</ul>		 550 false 2020-11-06T02:30:50.407007+00:00 Accounting and Finance 10 Upper McKinley Road Taguig Philippines Metro Manila 163242 false false 60000 Associate Consultant | Investment Banking 1 retirement special_for_women single_leave gym paid_holidays sick_leave perf_bonus life_ins paid_leave 1 <p><strong>Educational Qualifications &amp; Knowledge:</strong></p>

<p>The SOC Cybersecurity Command Center Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring that Dataprise is seen as a key security partner in the successful operation of customers’ IT environments. <p><strong>In this position, you will: </strong></p>
</li>
<li>Be responsible for customer and internal security updates.</li>
<li>Establish effective lines of communication with the Cybersecurity Specialist team and management to ensure cases are flagged that require immediate attention.</li>
<li>Provide support for complex network environments including problem solving, ability to take ownership of unfamiliar tasks and problems and seeing through to completion.</li>
<li>Take ownership of documenting incidents, maintenance and problem details in near real-time.</li>
<li>Detect and analyze alarms to provide basic to moderate fault isolation and troubleshooting, escalating to Cybersecurity Specialist or management if necessary.</li>
<li>Ensure SLA’s are met as per customer agreement.</li>
<li>Perform security event analysis and intrusion detection (IDS/IPS Incident response – triage, incident analysis, remediation).</li>
<li>Provide first level technical resolution for security alerts and SOC service requests.</li>
<li>Escalate first level security alerts to second tier SOC Analysts.</li>
<li>Demonstrate problem solving skills that contribute towards the resolution of any issues that arise. Document solutions, processes, or procedures and present them in writing, verbally on the phone or in person.</li>
<li>Utilize discretion and independent judgment in investigating and resolving matters of significance on behalf of management pertaining to customer security alerts and events</li>

<ul>
<li>You have a few years of industry related information security experience directly related to position requirements. You are highly analytically and have strong problem-solving skills.</li>
<li>You are an excellent communicator and can produce accurate communications in time sensitive situations.</li>
<li>You are able to work independently with minimum supervision and can take on additional tasks as required, prioritizing well and working within a small team to solve complex problems. You follow-through and take the initiative to stay with issues until they are resolved.</li>
<li>You are disciplined and tenacious when it comes to meeting deadlines.</li>
<li>You are very organized and have a strong attention to detail.  You are responsive, proactive, and own tasks from start to finish.</li>
<li>You have previous knowledge or a strong desire to learn about crisis management issues.</li>
<li>You are willing and able to be on-call and perform afterhours work as needed.</li>
</ul>

<p> </p>

<p><strong>Ideal Candidates will also have: </strong></p>

<ul>
<li>24x7 NOC/SOC experience, working for a MSSP, or internal enterprise small SOC teams.</li>
<li>Experience with SIEM/IDS technologies such as; Splunk, ELK, LogRhythm, Intel Security, HP Arcsight, AlienVault USM, IBM QRadar.</li>
<li>Knowledge of common methods of exploitation, such as buffer overflows, cross-site scripting, etc and have done incident response work.</li>
<li>A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or other tech-related degrees.</li>
<li>One or all of the following certifications: CompTIA Network+, Security+, CSA+, Cisco CCNA Cyber Ops, GIAC GSEC.</li>
<li>Strong analytical and planning skills;</li>
<li>Good communication and presentation skills;</li>
<li>Excellent problem-solving skills;</li>
</ul>		 85.71428571428571 true cyber-security-specialist Full time public 300

<p>Slidegenius is the premier global Presentation Design Agency with over 100+ employees. Our team of designers provides presentation design solutions to over 3,000 clients including Adidas, Reebok, Facebook, Blizzard, Delta Airlines, NASCAR, JP Morgan, and many more. We work with clients both big and small, providing us with new and exciting projects every day. In addition to PowerPoint, we offer a wide array of print services.</p>

<p>What the heck is a Financial Manager?</p>

<p>As a Financial Manager, you analyze financial data with consideration for the company’s goal and overseeing your team. You are responsible for implementing updates to accounting processes and reviewing the accuracy of data.</p>

<p>Responsibilities:</p>

<ul>
<li>Manage daily operations of the accounting department:</li>
<li>Invoicing</li>
<li>Accounts receivables</li>
<li>Budgeting &amp; Forecasting</li>
<li>Profit and Loss</li>
<li>Commissions</li>
<li>Assisting and analyzing spreadsheets</li>
<li>Review Retainer Clients</li>
<li>Client Details</li>
<li>Revenue Analysis</li>
<li>Lead Metrics</li>
<li>Client Credit Report</li>
<li>KPIs</li>
<li> Maintaining Harvest</li>
<li>Budgets</li>
<li>Project accuracy </li>
<li>Coordinate with clients</li>
<li>Implementing new projects</li>
<li>Manage and train financial analyst</li>
<li>Oversee financial analyst assistant</li>
<li>Provide recommendations</li>
<li>Practice critical thinking and problem solving</li>
<li>Comply with all company protocols and procedures</li>
<li>Manage administration tasks</li>
</ul>

<p>What is the office culture like?</p>

<p>Each SG Interactive office has its own fun and unique culture, developed by the diverse teams of designers and managers that work there. At the root of each office environment lies the foundational culture that was grown at our headquarters in San Diego.</p>

<p>Here in Manila, a city full of heart, we reflect that description in our office environment. Covering Asia hours and then some, the Asia office culture mirrors the collaborative foundations from our San Diego HQ to bring 24-hour coverage to SG Interactive. This has grown an environment of next level collaboration—a unique mix between independent space, colleagues within and across departments always willing to jump in and lend a hand, and an overall no-fuss can-do attitude. We strongly support each person's personal time, leading us to work hard and work well together so that when you go home, you can really go home. We enjoy all types of music, corny jokes, and a whole flurry of other interests brought about by each new person who joins the team.</p>

<p>Am I going to be able to grow with this company?</p>

<p>We offer a structured and transparent path for each member of the team. You will know where you stand at all times and your manager will highlight exactly what needs to be done in order for you to get to the place you want to be. In addition to offering growth within a given department, we also allow for inter-departmental growth if you show an aptitude in another area. And the growth doesn’t stop there, as the company itself is growing at an amazing rate, providing new and exciting opportunities for our team every day!</p>

<p>Okay, so… What's the catch?</p>

<p>The catch is that you have to bring your ‘A’ game. We expect our employees to bring positive, creative energy into the office everyday. That way we can face any challenge that gets thrown our way, knowing that we will be able to lean on each other for support</p>

<p>Where do I sign up?</p>

<p>If you think this position is a good fit for you and that you are a good fit for us, we would love for you to send in the following for us to review:</p>

<ul>
<li>Resume</li>
<li>Cover letter</li>
<li>Link to portfolio (digital or download)</li>
<li>Monthly/Salary request based on a 40 hour work week</li>
</ul>		 550 false 2020-11-09T08:38:18.166062+00:00 Accounting and Finance Unit 11-A Valero Tower Makati Philippines Metro Manila 163715 false false Financial Manager 5 single_leave med_ins sick_leave food family_leave paid_holidays paid_leave mat_pat_leave 1 <p>What sort of qualifications do I need?</p>

<p>As Manager for the Relationship Support team, you have direct commercial responsibility in handling regional team leads and individuals managing relationships for Platts’ long tail accounts. As a leader, you should have the managerial ability to build a best-in-class team and business plan to help S&amp;P Global Platts protect our existing business and drive exceptional growth in a sustainable manner that enhances our long term reputation in the marketplace and fosters strong customer relationships</p>

<p><strong>The Location: Silver City, Pasig City</strong></p>

<p><strong>The Team: </strong>Relationship Support (also known as Retention) is mandated to retain and grow our lower spend accounts. The team is expected to manage the full cycle of contracts, mostly market report subscribers, from renewals and price negotiations to regular check-ins throughout the client’s annual subscription period. Through engagement with contacts, the relationship managers are to share the value-add content and services that Platts provide as well as identify opportunities to grow the business and when necessary, manage risks to prevent cancellations.</p>

<p><strong>The Impact:</strong> Reporting to the Associate Director for Commercial Support, <strong>this role is mainly responsible for leading a team that is focused on maintaining and driving revenue growth of the accounts assigned to Manila and for ensuring the consistency of renewal operations for the local teams supporting Asia, EMEA and North American clients.</strong></p>

<p><strong>What’s in it for you:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Opportunity to join a pioneer, dynamic and fast-growing team</li>
<li>Exposure to Platts’ global commercial operations and business network across the division</li>
<li>Learn and grow within the thriving commodities market</li>
<li>Be part of a casual and friendly work environment with an entrepreneurial spirit</li>
<li>Occasional travel may be required</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Build a best-in-class commercial team by developing top talent. Manage resources and account distribution to fully capitalize individual capabilities while maximizing teamwork to function as a unified, motivated &amp; performing team to meet and exceed commercial objectives.</li>
<li>Bring to the team an understanding of how S&amp;P Global Platts operates globally, develop and instill the division’s One commercial culture</li>
<li><strong>Manage &amp; drive the creation &amp; assignment of business retention goals (ACV &amp; client), upsell/cross-sell targets and incentive plan for the team.</strong></li>
<li>Guide team to prioritize their work flow and client engagement efforts, focus and optimize their tasks as they relate to their short, mid &amp; long term goals to successfully retain and grow our long tail clients</li>
<li><strong>Lead team in complex negotiations &amp; assist in assessing opportunities and risks on complex/growth clients</strong></li>
<li><strong>Guide team to adapt a commercial mindset and plan business strategies through a deep understanding of industry requirements, market trends and client requirements</strong></li>
<li><strong>Develop a strong business development strategy for the local team to drive subscription growth and align with their respective regional targets (considering key markets, client segments and commodity sectors)</strong></li>
<li>Engage and nurture a small targeted set of potential growth accounts</li>
<li>Improve customer satisfaction/Net Promoter Score for the long tail set</li>
<li>Drive and embed best practice, commercial excellence and desired culture of values and behaviors, including the consistent adoption of the Diagnostic approach to engaging Platts clients</li>
<li>Drive consistent &amp; accurate retention pipeline management. Provide insights on day to day operational wins/challenges for reporting</li>
<li>Collaborate with all other functional departments and business regions to achieve end goals. This includes Regional Sales, Channel Partners, Content &amp; Product management, Marketing, Finance, Operations, Legal and colleagues from other SPGI businesses.</li>
</ul>		 550 true 2020-11-09T09:22:05.334489+00:00 Sales and Marketing Ugong Pasig Philippines Metro Manila 156816 false false Platts Commercial Manager | Retention 1 1 <p><strong>What We’re Looking For:</strong></p>

<li><strong>3-mos Project-Based</strong></li>
<li>Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget</li>
<li>Ensure resource availability and allocation</li>
<li>Develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress</li>
<li>Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule and project costs using appropriate verification techniques</li>
<li>Measure project performance using appropriate tools and techniques</li>
<li>Report and escalate to management as needed</li>
<li>Manage the relationship with the client</li>
<li>Perform risk management to minimize project risks</li>
<li>Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors</li>
<li>Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation</li>
<li>Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals</li>
<li>Meet budgetary objectives and make adjustments to project constraints based on financial analysis</li>
<li>Develop comprehensive project plans to be shared with clients as well as other staff members</li>
<li>Use and continually develop leadership skills</li>

Think Support Services Inc. 2020-10-24T15:58:18.187612+00:00 <p><strong>About Us </strong></p>

<p>Part of the Deep Blue Group of Companies, Think Support Services Inc (TSSI) is a fast-growing business delivering innovative, digital, and high volume solutions to the Australian retail property market. Working across multiple products and brands, with a focus on the sale and purchase of property connecting people, systems, and data across the pre-sale, building inspections, and conveyancing process through to settlement, we’re changing the face of the Australian retail property market.</p>

<p>We have newly created roles delivering service and sales solutions to customers within our Rapid Building Inspections business.</p>

<p> </p>

<p><strong>About the Team </strong></p>

<p>Rapid Building Inspections (RBI) is one of Australia's fastest-growing building &amp; pest inspection providers. Working across a wide majority of Australian states, our dedicated team conduct building, pest, dilapidation, stage and soon to be, depreciation inspections for residential homeowners, buyers, and sellers. Our qualified Building Inspectors on the ground in Australia are supported by a team of dedicated sales, service and support professionals in our Manila offices.</p>

<p> </p>

<p><strong>About the Role </strong></p>

<p>Supported by a comprehensive onboarding process, you will work as part of a team providing solutions and sales outcomes to our Australian customers.</p>

<p><strong>You will be responsible for:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li>Proactively assisting clients to identify and help them with their building inspection needs</li>
<li>Providing an excellent level of service via phone and email</li>
<li>Taking accountability for issue resolution and escalating problems where needed</li>
<li>Maintaining a strong communication performance culture amongst the team and ensuring team targets are achieved</li>
<li>Demonstrating you live and breathe our values and behaviors</li>

<p class="text-justify">You pride yourself on delivering great customer experiences. You confidently and quickly build relationships and give your customers confidence they’re in safe hands. You’re able to break down competing priorities autonomously to ensure you deliver to fixed deadlines. Highly organized, both your customers and your team know you can be depended on and are always reliable. You thrive in an environment where you can actively connect with customers to ensure the solutions you provide are genuinely meeting their needs.</p>

<p class="text-justify"><strong>With a completed Bachelor’s degree you will have:</strong></p>

<ul>
<li class="text-justify">2-3 years direct customer contact (written and phone based) experience working with Aust / NZ, US or UK customers</li>
<li class="text-justify">Expertise in Microsoft 365 applications</li>
<li class="text-justify">Experience in a sales environment delivering against targets and goals</li>
</ul>

<p class="text-justify"> </p>

<p class="text-justify"><strong>Working Location and Requirements </strong></p>

<p class="text-justify">Our teams are currently working from home however, this role will be based in our Makati head offices once circumstances allow. In order to be considered for this opportunity you must be able to demonstrate your home working environment is as follows:</p>

<ul>
<li class="text-justify">conducive home office (free from noise and distraction)</li>
<li class="text-justify">main internet: wired internet of at least 5mbps</li>
<li class="text-justify">reliable back up internet: at least 3mbps speed</li>
</ul>		 28.07017543859649 PHP month true client-services Full time public 200
